result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.notes: Follow all terms as set forth in Deferred Entry of Judgment
Follow all terms as set forth in Deferred Entry of Judgment

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan R Fisher

records.addlTxt: 10:30 AM Defendant Jonathan R Fisher in court.  Attorney Henry Francis Mcroberts in court for Jonathan R Fisher.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF08, 22TR14, 22TR15, 22TR16 and 22TR17. Seifert indicates there is a resolution, defendant would plead guilty or no contest in 22TR17 - joint recommendation of $812 fine, 6 month DL revocation and one year IID requirement. 22TR14, 22TR15 and 22TR16 will be dismissed. In 22CF08 - defendant would be pleading guilty to counts 1 & 2, with hold judgment and enter into a deferred entry of judgment for 24 months. Upon completion count one would be dismissed, count 2 would be confirmed with fine of $1000 plus costs. if fails to comply with DEJ - count 2 would be dismissed and count one would be brought back to court and parties would be free to argue on sentence. Mcroberts agrees has copy of DEJ and PLQ and provides to the court. Fisher agrees with what has been recited. On 22TR17 - defendant pleads guilty. Court finds guilty, imposes fine of $812, revokes DL for 6 months, AODA and follow through, IID requirement for one year. Court dismisses traffic citations, 22TR14, 22TR15 and 22TR16. On 22CF08 defendant pleads guilty to counts one and two. Court has PLQ, goes over the form with the defendant, finds he is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea, waiving his constitutional rights and right to trial, accepts pleas of guilty to counts 1 and 2. State asks court to follow joint recommendation, makes statement, no criminal history. Court questions statue regarding the amount of THC - discussion between all parties.  Mcroberts makes statement, asks court to follow joint recommendation and indicates there is bond on criminal case that could be applied. Court makes sure defendant understands what he is pleading to today. Mcroberts and Fisher agree and understand. Fisher makes statement, remorseful. Court accepts pleas of guilty, stays adjudication of guilt, accept deferred entry of judgment, follow terms as set forth in the agreement. Court converts cash bond in 22CF08 to a $5000 signature bond and transfers the $750 posted in 22CF08 to case 22TR17, remainder due 60 DTP/SL. No consumption of alcohol.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

02:30 PM Defendant Jonathan R Fisher in court with attorney Henry Francis Mcroberts.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jonathan R Fisher appeared by video means with Attorney. Court calls 22CF08, 22TR17, 22TR16, 22TR14 and 22TR15. State - here for PH but believe it is being waived. McRoberts and Fisher agree. McRoberts will efile the waiver form after Court. Court does waiver of right to PH collaquey, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed the Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts, set for PTC in 60 days. Court accepts plea, continues bond, track all traffic matters, continues bond, set for JT - if resolved, contact COC for a PLEAS.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on March 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

09:11 AM Defendant Jonathan R Fisher appears by video with attorney Henry Francis Mcroberts.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF08, 22TR17, 22TR16, 22TR15 and 22TR14. Mcroberts, waives further reading of complaint on CF case, asks for PH, waives time limits for PH and asks if tickets can track along. Court enters NG pleas on citations, if not already done so and will track citations with 22CF08, sets CF case for PH and continues bond. PH scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 2:30 PM.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on March 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.

09:31 AM Defendant Jonathan R Fisher in court.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jonathan R Fisher appeared by video means. Fisher does not have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Fisher undertands charges and penalties, will contact SPD and if not qualified - will hire his own. Court sets for AIA on 3/2/22 at 9:15 AM and move all open citations to the same date and time. Court explains what the next appearance is for as the defendant asked.
